sub section 1.1: In Q3 2024, Intel Corporation (INTC) reported revenue of $13.3 billion, which is a 4% increase sequentially (QoQ). Year-over-year (YoY) changes were not specified. The revenue was in the upper half of the guidance provided in Q2 2024. The growth was attributed to sequential increases in both Intel Products and Intel Foundry, despite navigating inventory challenges.

sub section 1.2: Wafer sales data and specific breakdowns regarding quantity and average selling price (ASP) were not provided in the context.

sub section 2.1: For Q3 2024, segment highlights reveal that the Intel Products segment generated $12.2 billion in revenue, up 3% sequentially, with an operating profit of $3.3 billion (27% margin). The Client Computing Group (CCG) saw a revenue decrease of 1% due to inventory reductions among customers. The Data Center and AI (DCAI) segment experienced a 10% revenue increase due to enhanced demand for traditional servers. The Network and Edge (NEX) segment also exhibited double-digit revenue growth.

sub section 2.2: Management did not provide specific sales guidance for Q4 2024. However, they indicated that Q1 typically experiences seasonality in the 8% to 10% range.
